extinfbow

Class ExtInfBowInputCorpusReaderAndProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • extinfbow.ExtInfBowInputCorpusReaderAndProcessor

  • public class ExtInfBowInputCorpusReaderAndProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    The class responsible for reading and processing the input corpus from which the information will be extracted using the bag-of-words method.

      static void readFilesEnNewParser()
      This function reads in the files of an English corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is parsed with the C&C CCG parser (https://github.com/chrzyki/candc), the POS tags of words are in 2nd position, and the text files are in the main directory of the curpus.
      static void readFilesEnOldParser()
      This function reads in the files of an English corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is parsed with the C&C CCG parser (https://github.com/chrzyki/candc), the POS tags of words are in 3rd position, and the text files are in the subdirectories of the main directory of the curpus.

        public ExtInfBowInputCorpusReaderAndProcessor()

    • Method Detail

      • readFilesEnNewParser

        public static void readFilesEnNewParser()
        This function reads in the files of an English corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is parsed with the C&C CCG parser (https://github.com/chrzyki/candc), the POS tags of words are in 2nd position, and the text files are in the main directory of the curpus.

      • readFilesEnOldParser

        public static void readFilesEnOldParser()
        This function reads in the files of an English corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is parsed with the C&C CCG parser (https://github.com/chrzyki/candc), the POS tags of words are in 3rd position, and the text files are in the subdirectories of the main directory of the curpus.

      • readFileEnParser

        public static void readFileEnParser(java.lang.String filePath)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads a file of the parsed English corpus to extract information from it. As this is a bag-of-words approach, it does not use the grammatical relation (the lines starting with a bracket), it only uses the sentences (the lines starting with >). It makes every line lowercase, and replaces some special characters (those special characters are used in the information files). In case of there are sentence frequencies at the end of each sentence (e.g. Web1T5GramCorpus), then it uses those sentence frequencies.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception

      • processLineEnParsed

        public static void processLineEnParsed(java.lang.String line,
                                       long numberOfSentences,
                                       int positionOfPOSTag)
        This function is responsible for processing the lines of a parsed English corpus and for extracting the necessary information. It first separates the words form their POS tag. Then, for each word it calls the apropriate function, based on the word's POS, which extracts the relevant infromation from the neighborhood of the word.
        Parameters:
        line - the line
        numberOfSentences - the frequency of the sentence (the number of times it occured in the corpus)
        positionOfPOSTag - the position of the POS tag

      • processLineEnParsed

        public static long processLineEnParsed(java.lang.String[] words,
                                       int i,
                                       net.didion.jwnl.data.POS pos,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> tuplesMap1,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> simpleTuplesMap1,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> tuplesMap2,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap1,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap2,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap3,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> simpleFrequencyMap3,
                                       long numberOfSentences)
                                throws net.didion.jwnl.JWNLException
        This function extracts the relevant infromation from the neighborhood of the word. It first determines which words are inside the used window. Then, it determines the lemma of the current word. Finally, it extracts the words in the window and saves them to the relevant map/set with a frequency that decreases quadratically with the distance. A part of the information is only stored for those words that are in the allInputWords set (further, the wordType==WordType.WordsInWn version of this method stores the information for only those words that are included in wordnet).
        Parameters:
        words - the words in the sentence
        i - the position of the current word
        pos - the pos of the current word
        tuplesMap1 - the map in which the (word, feature) pairs with their frequency are stored
        simpleTuplesMap1 - the map in which the (word, feature) pairs with their frequency are stored, with everything counted only once
        tuplesMap2 - the map in which the (feature, word) pairs with their frequency are stored
        frequencyMap1 - the map in which the frequencies of the features with the given type of word are stored
        frequencyMap2 - the map in which the frequencies of the words with the given type of features are stored
        frequencyMap3 - the map in which the frequencies of the words of a given POS are stored
        simpleFrequencyMap3 - the map in which the frequencies of the words of a given POS are stored, with everything counted only once
        numberOfSentences - the sentence frequency
        Returns:
        the number, by which the relevant allXXXCount variable should be increased
        Throws:
        net.didion.jwnl.JWNLException - exception

      • readFilesHuParser

        public static void readFilesHuParser()
        This function reads in the files of a Hungarian corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is parsed with the Magyar lanc (Hunposchain) parser. Each file is in a main dir.

      • readFileHuParser

        public static void readFileHuParser(java.lang.String filePath)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads a file of the parsed Hungarian corpus to extract information from it. It replaces some special characters (those special characters are used in the information files). It processes the parsed Hungarian corpus by sentences.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception

      • processLineHuParsed

        public static void processLineHuParsed(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> POSTags,
                                       long numberOfSentences)
        This function is responsible for processing the sentences of a parsed Hungarian corpus and for extracting the necessary information. For each word in the sentence it calls the apropriate function, based on the word's POS, which extracts the relevant infromation from the neighborhood of the word.
        Parameters:
        words - the ArrayList containing the words of the sentence
        POSTags - the ArrayList containing the POS tags of the words of the sentence
        numberOfSentences - the sentence frequency

      • processLineHuParsedOrEsTagged

        public static long processLineHuParsedOrEsTagged(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words,
                                                 int i,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> tuplesMap1,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> simpleTuplesMap1,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> tuplesMap2,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap1,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap2,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> frequencyMap3,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> simpleFrequencyMap3,
                                                 long numberOfSentences)
        This function extracts the relevant infromation from the neighborhood of the word in case of Hungarian and Spanish sentences. It first determines which words are inside the used window. Then, it extracts the words in the window and saves them to the relevant map/set with a frequency that decreases quadratically with the distance. A part of the information is only stored for those words that are in the allInputWords set.
        Parameters:
        words - the words in the sentence
        i - the position of the current word
        tuplesMap1 - the map in which the (word, feature) pairs with their frequency are stored
        simpleTuplesMap1 - the map in which the (word, feature) pairs with their frequency are stored, with everything counted only once
        tuplesMap2 - the map in which the (feature, word) pairs with their frequency are stored
        frequencyMap1 - the map in which the frequencies of the features with the given type of word are stored
        frequencyMap2 - the map in which the frequencies of the words with the given type of features are stored
        frequencyMap3 - the map in which the frequencies of the words of a given POS are stored
        simpleFrequencyMap3 - the map in which the frequencies of the words of a given POS are stored, with everything counted only once
        numberOfSentences - the sentence frequency
        Returns:
        the number, by which the relevant allXXXCount variable should be increased

      • readFilesEsTagger

        public static void readFilesEsTagger()
        This function reads in the files of a Spanish corpus to extract information from it, when the corpus is tagged with Freelilng. Each file is in a main dir.

      • readFileEsTagger

        public static void readFileEsTagger(java.lang.String filePath)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads a file of the tagged Spanish corpus to extract information from it. It replaces some special characters (those special characters are used in the information files). It processes the tagged Spanish corpus by sentences.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception

      • processLineEsTagged

        public static void processLineEsTagged(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> POSTags,
                                       long numberOfSentences)
        This function is responsible for processing the sentences of a tagged Spanish corpus and for extracting the necessary information. For each word in the sentence it calls the apropriate function, based on the word's POS, which extracts the relevant infromation from the neighborhood of the word.
        Parameters:
        words - the ArrayList containing the words of the sentence
        POSTags - the ArrayList containing the POS tags of the words of the sentence
        numberOfSentences - the sentence frequency
